gr.interamerican.bo2.impl.open.jdbc
Class JdbcQuery

java.lang.Object
  gr.interamerican.bo2.impl.open.workers.AbstractBaseWorker
      gr.interamerican.bo2.impl.open.workers.AbstractResourceConsumer
          gr.interamerican.bo2.impl.open.jdbc.AbstractJdbcWorker
              gr.interamerican.bo2.impl.open.jdbc.JdbcQuery
All Implemented Interfaces:
NamedFieldsContainer, OrderedFieldsContainer, Query, Worker
Direct Known Subclasses:
DynamicJdbcQuery, JdbcStaticQuery
public abstract class JdbcQuery
extends AbstractJdbcWorker
implements Query, NamedFieldsContainer, OrderedFieldsContainer

Abstract implementation of Query based on JDBC.

protected String getSqlFromResourceFile(String path)
Utility method meant to get an SQL statement from a resource file. This is meant for use in the implementation of sql()

Parameters:
path - Resource path.
Returns:
SQL statement.

parameters

protected Object[] parameters()
Parameters for the query.
If the query does not need parameters, this method should return null or an empty array.
The default implementation fetches an array with the named parameters.

Returns:
Returns an array with parameters for the query.

getParameterNamesArray

protected String[] getParameterNamesArray()
Description copied from class: AbstractBaseWorker
Gets an array that contains the names of this workers' parameters ordered as they must be entered to the underlying data layer object. The base implementation leverages the existence of a ParametersOrder annotation on the class.

Overrides:
getParameterNamesArray in class AbstractBaseWorker
Returns:
Returns an array with the parameter names.

setAvoidLock

public void setAvoidLock(boolean avoidLock)
Description copied from interface: Query
Instructs the query to avoid putting any lock to the data it reads. Calling this method on a query with true instructs the query to avoid putting any locks to the data it reads. In case the query runs inside a transaction the fetched data should be locked, since update on these data would affect the current transaction. But in case the query does not run inside a transaction it could be acceptable to let data be modified by other threads, while it might be unacceptable to lock the data for a long time. In the latter case, the query should be instructed to avoid locks.
It is possible that the technology used for the implementation of the query can't support calling locking or avoiding locks. In such case, the method should throw a DataOperationNotSupportedException if this method is called with an argument true or false that can't be supported.

Specified by:
setAvoidLock in interface Query
Parameters:
avoidLock - Indicates if the query will avoid to lock fetched data.

isAvoidLock

public boolean isAvoidLock()
Description copied from interface: Query
Indicates if the query will avoid to lock fetched data from access by other threads.

Specified by:
isAvoidLock in interface Query
Returns:
Returns an indicator showing if the query will avoid to lock fetched data from access by other threads.
See Also:
Query.setAvoidLock(boolean)
